chunks.content:
Driver Check-In Manual

Overview

Driver Check-In is responsible for ensuring all documentation, returned products, and equipment from drivers are properly collected, verified, organized, and routed to the correct departments. This team is essential for end-of-day accountability, inventory accuracy, product quality control, and clear communication across the company.

Core Responsibilities

Bring every truck in as drivers return.

Ensure drivers clean the backs of their trucks.

Remove and organize pallets from each truck.

Collect all paperwork, including invoices and Driver Return Forms.

Verify all returned cases and confirm that the driver’s stated reason is correct

Sort all returned items into the correct zones (refused, meat/produce/eggs/chicken, vendor returns)

Track which trucks are back, and which remain on the road.

Deliver invoices to Invoice Cleaning once a cart is filled.

Ensure pallets are organized into uniform stacks (ideally 13 high) for night shift use.

Ensure straps and blankets are placed into their proper containers for loaders.

Stay on duty until transportation clears all remaining drivers.

Driver Return Forms

All drivers return two key documents:

Their invoice packet (white & yellow sheets for each stop).

Driver Return Form.

Potential Pick Up form

Driver Return Form fields:

Driver name

Route number

Helper name (if applicable)

Straps and blanket count

Signature

Returned cases section (customer, order #, item description, item #, reason code)

Color coding:

• School drivers → Green driver return form

• All others → White driver return form

Return Reason Codes

1 – Mispick

2 – Short on Load

3 – Short / Found on Truck

4 – Sales Error

5 – Product Quality / Temperature Issue

6 – Product / Case Damaged

7 – NYC DOE Refused (Schools only)

8 – Product Over

Returned Product Processing

Driver Check-In verifies each returned case and organizes as follows:

Behind the team: All refused cases

Left side: Meat, poultry, fish, eggs, produce returns

Front area: Vendor returns and customer pickups

Vendor returns are later moved to Receiving.
synthetic_questions: What are the core responsibilities of the Driver Check-In team?
How do I sort returned cases like refused, meat/produce, and vendor returns?
What's reason code 7 on the Driver Return Form?
I'm confused about the color coding for Driver Return Forms—what's green for?
Walk me through verifying a Driver Return Form and processing the returns with reason codes.
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core end-of-day business process for inventory and accountability, detailed steps and codes make it actionable and mostly self-contained for driver check-in team

acronyms.NYC DOE: New York City Department of Education

jargon.Driver Check-In: Team/process for collecting, verifying, and routing driver documentation, returns, and equipment at end-of-day
jargon.Driver Return Form: Document drivers complete detailing returns, including driver info, straps/blanket counts, and returned cases with reason codes
jargon.mispick: Return reason code 1: Incorrect item picked or delivered
jargon.Short on Load: Return reason code 2: Insufficient quantity loaded for delivery
jargon.refused cases: Customer-refused products, organized behind the Driver Check-In team
jargon.vendor returns: Supplier-destined returns, initially organized in front area then moved to Receiving
jargon.Invoice Cleaning: Destination for batched invoices after verification

pallet_stack_height.context: Ideal uniform stack height for pallets for night shift use

chunks.content:
Refused/damaged/expired cases cannot be returned to inventory and must be documented accurately.

Customer Pick-Up Report

Driver Check-In must review and mark off the Customer Pick-Up Report daily. This report lists all cases scheduled to be picked up from customers. Checking off each pickup confirms the request was fulfilled, ensuring the rest of the company, especially Sales, Transportation, and Invoice Cleaning knows that the customer’s needs were completed accurately.

This step is critical because:

It prevents missed credits.

Confirms customer satisfaction.

Ensures returned product is properly routed.

Maintains accurate inventory and financial records.

Invoice Collection & Delivery

Each truck’s invoice count must match the number of scheduled stops. Once verified, invoices are placed in a rolling cart. When full, the cart is delivered to Invoice Cleaning so that credits, adjustments, and billing can be finalized.

End-of-Day Protocol

Two Driver Check-In team members remain on duty until transportation confirms whether remaining drivers have cases returning. If drivers have returns, the team must remain until those cases are processed and placed appropriately. If not, transportation instructs those drivers to submit invoices directly to Invoice Cleaning, allowing the Driver Check-In team to close out.

All pallets, equipment, and paperwork must be organized and accounted for before departure.
synthetic_questions: What do I do with refused, damaged, or expired cases at Driver Check-In?
How do I handle the Customer Pick-Up Report each day?
What's the end-of-day protocol if drivers still have returns coming in?
Why is marking off the Customer Pick-Up Report so critical for Invoice Cleaning?
We're stuck waiting at end of day because transportation hasn't confirmed returns yet—what's the rule here?
chunks.quality_reasoning: Core operational procedures for inventory accuracy, credits, and end-of-day closeout in Driver Check-In; specific to team tasks but straightforward and actionable with minimal context needed.

jargon.cases: Units of product (e.g., containers or shipments) that can be refused, damaged, expired, picked up, or returned
jargon.Customer Pick-Up Report: Daily report listing all cases scheduled for customer pickup, used to confirm fulfillment
jargon.Driver Check-In: Team or process responsible for reviewing pickups, verifying invoices, and processing returns
jargon.Invoice Cleaning: Department or process for finalizing credits, adjustments, and billing from collected invoices
jargon.rolling cart: Cart used to transport batches of verified invoices to Invoice Cleaning
